TopicTitle: Could the character limit for signatures be increased?

Articles.Content:
Either globally or per user?

I like having a whole bunch of links mostly mod related in my signature for the benefit of others, and I keep having to compromise.

It's 1000 right now. Please increase it to 2000 at least. There's no harm is there? An overwhelming majority of users don't even bother reaching the limit. It's not really necessary.

Not sure if you're using it already, but if they are forum links you can shorten the character count considerably by using the [noparse][thread] tag. This:

[thread=104899]This thread.[/thread][/noparse]

gives this:

[thread=104899]This thread.[/thread]

Not exactly a solution, but can help make the limit less painful.

Similarly, if you wish to link to a specific post, you can shorten it in the same fashion, although you'll need to be a little more careful about which number you take from the original link to put in th BBCode.

As an example, one of the links in your signature is:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/99521?p=[B]1567918[/B]&viewfull=1#post1567918

I've bolded the section you need to use for the post BBCode; it's quite similar to the thread BBCode:

[noparse][post=1567918]Link text here[/post][/noparse]

Which yields: Link text here

As to actually increasing the limit, it's something only our administrators can decide and/or put into effect. They're all on brief Christmas leave, though, so it may be a couple more days until one of them drops by with an answer.
Thanks I think those will do for now.
